Detailed Description

When two or more threads need to access a shared resource at the same time, synchronization is a coordination process to ensure that the resource is used by only one thread at a time. Mutex is a synchronization primitive that allows exclusive access to the shared resource to only one thread. If the mutex lock of an object is acquired by a thread, the second thread that wants to acquire the lock is suspended until the lock is released by the first thread.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN Mutex::Create (  BOOLEAN  locked = TRUE  ) 
 

Parameters:
locked TRUE to create the mutex in non-signaled state, FALSE for signaled state.

BOOLEAN Mutex::Obtain (  const Ticks &  timeout = Ticks::Infinite()  ) 
 

Obtain is used to request ownership of the mutex. The state of the mutex is signaled if no thread owns it. The thread that owns a mutex can specify the same mutex in repeated Obtain function calls without blocking its execution.

Parameters:
timeout Specifies the time-out interval, in milliseconds.
Returns:
TRUE if the state is signaled. FALSE if the time-out interval elapsed.

void Mutex::Release (   ) 
 

The thread must call Release the same number of times to release ownership of the mutex lock.
